headers.subject: Re: [humanmarkup] OASIS Word Version for Proofreading
headers.x-spam-status: No, score=2.0 required=5.0 tests=BAYES_40,HTML_MESSAGE, HTML_MIME_NO_HTML_TAG,INVALID_DATE,MIME_HTML_ONLY,NO_RECEIVED,NO_RELAYS autolearn=disabled version=3.2.4

body.para: Yep, I got it done. Almost. I was obviously pretty tired of working on this thing since I did not bother to update the Table of Contents, which I don't really like in Word XP, and haven't like since Word 97, which was the best version for my dime, back when they GOT it that they had gone way overboard on Word 6.0, but they have since gone nuts again, so what else is new.

Anyway, I have fixed that, so you don't have to draw my attention to that in the proofreading. I just thought I would let you know. As I started on the html version I went looking to see how other TCs had handled it, and guess what... they didn't. If we were not HumanMarkup we could ignore it too, eh? But we can't really neglect any human-readable format, so I guess I will do a pdf version, too.
body.footer: -- Rex Brooks Starbourne Communications Design 1361-A Addison, Berkeley, CA 94702 *510-849-2309 http://www.starbourne.com * rexb@starbourne.com
